page.title: 15HOUSING
page.content: A lot of houses in Branston are very old, but a lot are new.We have some cottages built in the 18th century. Branston Hall was built then and around it,many houses were built. Some of these houses still survive. Most of the houses in the village were built since the 2nd world war. There are 3 new housing estates,the Valley estate, the High Moor estate and the Brook - fields estate which is still being built.Mr Taylor is building Brookfield and he will still be building here in about 3 years time. He builds semi detached and detached bungalows which cost Â£23,000 to Â£24,000 and semi detached and detached houses which cost from Â£19,000 to Â£30,000. They are all made of brick. He only does 2 to 3 bedroom houses and bungalows. Most houses are owner-occupied,but there are some council houses too.
